model

Interface IPortfolio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Portfolio

    public interface IPortfolio

    A portfolio of stocks is simply a collection of stocks (e.g. 10 shares of company X, 10 shares of company Y, etc.). The total value of a portfolio is then the sum of the values of its individual holdings. Thus the value of a portfolio, much like individual stocks, also changes with time. As an example, we hear about the SandP 500, Dow Jones Industrial and NASDAQ in the news, quoted to gauge the health of the overall stock market. These three indices are nothing more than portfolios of stocks of specific companies, which have been found to be reasonable barometers of the health of the overall stock market and economy.

    This interface allows various operations on portfolio objects such as adding stocks to the portfolio, and calculate valuation of the portfolio.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addStocksToPortfolio(Stock newStock)
      This is used to add stocks to a portfolio.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStockNamesInPortfolio()

      java.lang.String lastestTransactionDate()
      This method will yield the latest transaction date on which a new stock was purchased.
      PortfolioTransferable valuationForPortfolio(java.lang.String timestamp)
      This method returns a Portfolio Transferable object has all the calculation form the Portfolio and eventually return to the controller.

    • Method Detail

      • addStocksToPortfolio

        void addStocksToPortfolio(Stock newStock)
        This is used to add stocks to a portfolio. This method takes in a new stock and adds theh new stock to the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        newStock - new stock.

      • valuationForPortfolio

        PortfolioTransferable valuationForPortfolio(java.lang.String timestamp)
        This method returns a Portfolio Transferable object has all the calculation form the Portfolio and eventually return to the controller.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the time stamp.
        Returns:
        PortfolioTransferable object that contains all the calculations.

      • getStockNamesInPortfolio

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStockNamesInPortfolio()
        This method will yield the copy of the stock names in the portfolio.
        Returns:
        List of stock names contained in the portfolio.

      • lastestTransactionDate

        java.lang.String lastestTransactionDate()
        This method will yield the latest transaction date on which a new stock was purchased.
        Returns:
        the latest time stamp.
